data.name: AWS Lambda
data.description: View of key metrics relating to the health and performance of deployed AWS Lambda functions.

markdown.markdownText:
**AWS Lambda**
![AWS Lambda](https://icon.icepanel.io/AWS/svg/Compute/Lambda.svg)
AWS Lambda is a serverless compute service that runs your code in response to events and automatically manages the underlying compute resources for you, making it easier to build applications that respond quickly to new information.

**Details of integrations to bring in AWS Lambda logs** [aws-lambda-cloudwatch-metrics](https://coralogix.com/docs/cloudwatch-metricstreams-kinesis-data-firehose/)

**Use Cases Covered**

1. Invocation metrics - binary indicator of the outcome of a Lambda function invocation
2. Performance metrics - performance details about a single function invocation
3. Asynchronous Invocation metrics - provide details about asynchronous invocations from event sources and direct invocations
4. Concurrency Metrics - Lambda reports concurrency metrics as an aggregate count of the number of instances processing events across a function, version, alias, or AWS region

**More about performance monitoring of AWS Lambda** [here](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/lambda/latest/dg/monitoring-metrics.html)

widgets.title: Overall Failure Rate (% Total Invocations)
widgets.description: Total failures against total invocations

widgets.title: Overall Failure Rate (% Total Invocations)
widgets.description: Total failures against total invocations

widgets.title: Invocation Errors by Function
widgets.description: Number of invocations that result in a function error. Function errors include exceptions that your code and Lambda runtime throws

widgets.title: Overall Throttle Rate (% Total Invocations)
widgets.description: Total throttles against total invocations

widgets.title: Total Throttles
widgets.description: The number of invocation requests that are throttled. When all function instances are processing requests and no concurrency is available to scale up, Lambda rejects additional requests with a TooManyRequestsException error. Throttled requests and other invocation errors don't count as either Invocations or Errors

widgets.title: Total Invocations
widgets.description: Total number of invocations across all functions and regions in the selected time period

widgets.title: Total Invocations
widgets.description: Number of times that your function code is invoked, including successful invocations and invocations that result in a function error. Invocations aren't recorded if the invocation request is throttled or otherwise results in an invocation error

widgets.title: Total Invocations By Function (Top 20)
widgets.description: Number of times that your function code is invoked, including successful invocations and invocations that result in a function error. Invocations aren't recorded if the invocation request is throttled or otherwise results in an invocation error

widgets.title: Total Errors
widgets.description: Number of invocations that result in a function error. Function errors include exceptions that your code throws and exceptions that the Lambda runtime throws. The runtime returns errors for issues such as timeouts and configuration errors

widgets.title: Total Errors By Function (Top 20)
widgets.description: The number of invocations that result in a function error. Function errors include exceptions that your code and Lambda runtime throw

widgets.title: Functions by Avg Duration (Top 20)
widgets.description: Amount of time that your function code spends processing an event in milliseconds. Duration does not include cold start time

widgets.title: Avg Duration by Function
widgets.description: Amount of time that your function code spends processing an event in milliseconds. Duration does not include cold start time

widgets.title: Max Duration by Function
widgets.description: Amount of time that your function code spends processing an event in milliseconds. Duration does not include cold start time

widgets.title: Min Duration by Function
widgets.description: Amount of time that your function code spends processing an event in milliseconds. Duration does not include cold start time

widgets.title: IteratorAge
widgets.description: For DynamoDB, Kinesis, and Amazon DocumentDB event sources, the age of the last record in the event. This metric measures the time between when a stream receives the record and when the event source mapping sends the event to the function.

widgets.title: PostRuntimeExtensionsDuration
widgets.description: Cumulative amount of time that the runtime spends running code for extensions after the function code has completed.

widgets.title: Async Events Received
widgets.description: asynchronous invocations from event sources and direct invocations. Mismatches between AsyncEventsReceived and Invocations can indicate a disparity in processing, events being dropped, or a potential queue backlog

widgets.title: Async Events Dropped
widgets.description: The number of events that are dropped without successfully executing the function

widgets.title: Async Events Age
widgets.description: The time between when Lambda successfully queues the event and when the function is invoked. The value of this metric increases when events are being retried due to invocation failures or throttling

widgets.title: Concurrent Executions
widgets.description: Instances that are processing events. If this number reaches your concurrent executions quota for the Region, or the reserved concurrency limit on the function, then Lambda throttles additional invocation requests

widgets.title: Provisioned Concurrent Executions
widgets.description: Number of function instances that are processing events using provisioned concurrency

widgets.title: Unreserved Concurrent Executions
widgets.description: Number of events that functions without reserved concurrency are processing

widgets.title: Claimed Account Concurrency
widgets.description: Amount of concurrency that is unavailable for on-demand invocations
